DataElement.preferredName: Patient Measurable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/not/not applicable indicator regarding whether a person has a tumor that can be accurately measured in size.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Measurable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Measurable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have at least on
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have at least one measurable lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension as greater than or equal to 1.5 cm with spiral CT scan, MRI scan, or physical exam (by calipers only)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have at least one measurable lesion that can be accurately measured with spiral CT scan, MRI scan, or physical exam (by calipers only)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has measurable systemic (i.e. non-CNS) disease, can it be accurately measured in at least one dimension (longest diameter to be recorded for non-nodal lesions and short axis for nodal lesions) as greater than or equal to 20 mm (greater than or equal to 2 cm) with conventional techniques or as greater than or equal to 10 mm (greater than or equal to 1 cm) with spiral CT scan, MRI, or calipers by clinical exam?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease based on mSWAT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have radiographically or clinically measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic disease or locally recurrent, unresectable disease with measurable lymph node metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to the pharmacodynamics or disease specific expansion cohorts, does patient have measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has extracranial disease, do they have at least 1 lesion, not previously irradiated, that can be accurately measured at baseline as greater than or equal to 10mm in the longest diameter (except lymph nodes which must have short axis greater than or equal to 15mm) OR at least one lesion (measurable and/or non-measurable) that can be accurately assessed by CT/MRI/pain x-ray/clinical exam at baseline and follow up visits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has extracranial disease, do they have at least 1 lesion, not previously irradiated, that can be accurately measured at baseline as greater than or equal to 10mm in the longest diameter (except lymph nodes which must have short axis greater than or equal to 15mm) with computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging OR greater than or equal to 10 mm with calipers by clinical exam OR at least one lesion (measurable and/or non-measurable) that can be accurately assessed by CT/MRI/pain x-ray/clinical exam at baseline and follow up visits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease, defined as at least 1 lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension as greater than or equal to 1 cm on brain MRI but with the maximum dimension less than or equal to 5 cm OR gross tumor volume less than 20 cm3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has extracranial disease, do they have at least 1 lesion, not previously irradiated, that can be accurately measured at baseline as greater than or equal to 10 mm in the longest diameter (except lymph nodes which must have short axis greater than or equal to 15 mm) OR at least one lesion (measurable and/or non-measurable) that can be accurately assessed by CT/MRI/clinical exam at baseline and follow up visits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have two-dimensional measurable tumor greater than or equal to 1 cm2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have at least one lesion, not previously irradiated, that can be accurately measured at baseline as greater than or equal to 10 mm in the longest diameter (except lymph nodes which must have short axis greater than or equal to  15 mm) with computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or greater than or equal to 10 mm with callipers by clinical exam OR at least one lesion (measurable) that can be accurately assessed by CT/MRI/clinical exam at baseline and follow up visits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a two-dimensional measurable tumor greater than or equal to 1 cm2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease or if has neuroblastoma without measurable soft tissue does patient have MIBG avid disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Phase 2 only:  Does patient have measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there documentation by PET/CT scan, CT scan, or MRI that the patient has measurable metastatic disease per RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient's total gross tumor volume measure less than 100 cc?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease with dFLC greater than or equal to 4mg/dL (40 mg/L)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the maximum diameter of the lesions not to be resected less than 4.0 cm?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Expansion Cohort only: Does patient have measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the maximum diameter of any lesion, which will not be resected, less than or equal to 4.0 cm in maximum diameter?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a second measurable lesion outside of the biopsiable lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a resected primary tumor that was greater than or equal to 5 cm?
